messages.subject: [Fwd: Unable to deliver your message]
messages.messageBody:
Another resend that looks like a quote:


> Our schools here started while we were in SC. Brian's been going through a difficult, clingy period for the past few weeks, and it was only within DAYS of school's starting that I realized (kinda like I
> realized on my dd's 6 week b'day that I'd be back to work now if following the mainstream) that he would (mainstream) *have to* go to K NOW.
>
> That would have been a disaster. Some other time it would be merely a very bad thing, but this particular month it would be at least triple bad, but we'd feel we had no choice.
>
> Thanks to everyone here, everyone at unschooling.com, and all homeschoolers everywhere for letting us know we HAVE A CHOICE!
>
> :-) Diane
>
> ejcrewe@... wrote:
>
> > This morning, while reading the newspaper and drinking coffee and waiting for
> > my kids to wake up, I saw the parade of parents and children trekking down
> > for the first day of public school. Catholic schools started yesterday, but my
> > neighbors drive instead of walking, so it's less of a spectacle.
